results.title: Chaplin's first films
results.brief_description: A selection of Chaplin’s early films illustrating the development of his art form from slapstick to a subtle mixture of pathos and comedy. Excerpts from the following are included in this compilation: “Some Nerve”, “Making a Living”, “Mabel’s Strange Predicament”, “Tillie’s Punctured Romance”, “His Prehistoric Past”, “The Champion” and “The Tramp”.

results.creator_credit: George Dunning, Jean-Paul Ladouceur, Cine-Photographie and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Tone poem: moods in the forest
results.creator_credit: African Film Productions and South Africa Railways
results.brief_description: A short colonial film that contrasts a woman collecting flowers in a dense South African forest with men logging the forest around her. The images are complimented by a musical arrangement by Michael Dorre conducting the Johannesburg Colosseum Symphony Orchestra. The film concludes with a title “Thus the sun illumined forests of the Cape”

results.title: Changing places: a social studies resource
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson, Gibson Film Productions and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A series of vignettes which show the contrasts that exist between groups within a modern industrial society - between the rich and poor, the free and the imprisoned, etc.

results.title: The Changing Middle East
results.creator_credit: Sam Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Discusses the history of the Middle East. Contrasts old ways with the new in agriculture, industry etc. in emphasizing the changing image of this part of the world.

results.title: The Changing hills
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Dennis Hill Productions
results.brief_description: Tells of the way in which the Snowy Mountains Hydro-electric Scheme has altered the area and its way of life. Traces the development of the scheme, outlining the vast scientific and engineering resources and processes bringing the project to fruition. Shows how the project has brought new leisure and pleasure to Australia and Australians.

results.title: The Changing forest
results.creator_credit: Maurice Constant, J.V. Durden, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A brief essay on the ecology of a forest area of the type found along the southern fringes of the Laurentian Shield. We see the forest as an integrated community of living things, both plant and animal, balanced by conflict as well as by harmony, and learn why the maple tree is best able to survive the struggle for supremacy in the Laurentian forest area. Awards: New York; Rome
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maurice Constant, J.V. Durden, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Changing forest
results.creator_credit: Patrick Carey, John Taylor, National Benzole and Pilot Films
results.brief_description: This film is about the work the Forestry Commission is doing by way of land conservation and re-afforestation over their two-and-a-half million acres in Britain. Their interest in preservation of wild life and use of land for recreation is also outlined. Shots of Scotland and the Lake District at various seasons of the year are included.
